By Elizabeth Uwandu 
GOVERNOR Akinwunmi Ambode of Lagos State has urged winners of the 2017 United Kingdom Alumni Awards to take advantage of government programmes in order to contribute to national development. 
Speaking at the event hosted by Connie Price, Country Director, British Council in Lagos, Nigeria, Ambode, represented by Special Adviser on Education, Obafela Bank-Olemoh, who commended the British Council for the impact of its education on Nigerians who school in the United Kingdom. 
His words; “It’s a laudable initiative to award Nigerians that have impacted Nigeria. We are in a global world with a very mobile population. 
“As a government, it’s our desire to reduce the amount of money spent on foreign education and by the time we are able to raise the standard of education in Nigeria, there would be less crave for western education in Africa” 
Bank-Olemoh continued; “Foreign education is good, because it expands your scope, but the need to invest in quality education in Africa is critical for us. It is good to see Nigerians traveling abroad to be educated and coming back and impact Nigeria. Tony
